article_text:
Photo

On Friday, the Federal Reserve released the transcripts of its policy meetings of 2008, a year that began with little hint that a recession and a world financial crisis were unfolding. The transcripts provide new insights into the debates, miscalculations and actions of the Fed’s policy making council, the Federal Open Market Committee, in assessing and countering the crisis. In a running analysis of the documents, reporters for The New York Times shared their findings.
